perturbation.original_text: "Territory" means the geographical region described in the attached EXHIBIT D.
perturbation.changed_text: "Territory" means the entire world, without limitation.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of "Territory" limits the reseller's activities to a specific geographic region defined in Exhibit D. By changing the definition to "the entire world, without limitation," we create a contradiction. Sections of the agreement that rely on the original, limited definition (such as clauses regarding marketing efforts or non-compete obligations) now conflict with this unlimited definition. This introduces uncertainty about where the reseller is authorized to operate and which markets are protected by the agreement.

perturbation.original_text:
4.11 PERFORMANCE QUOTAS. Each Annual Marketing Plan developed by Reseller
           during the term of this Agreement and any extension thereof shall
           contain quotas mutually agreed between TouchStar and Reseller for the
           sale by Reseller of TouchStar Software and Support Services in the
           Territory for the year to which such Annual Marketing Plan relates
           (the "Quotas"). Reseller acknowledges that meeting the Quotas is an
           essential element of this Agreement and that this Agreement may be
           terminated by TouchStar if, in TouchStar's reasonable opinion,
           Reseller will not meet the Quotas during the Term or any extension
           thereof.
perturbation.changed_text:
4.11 PERFORMANCE QUOTAS. Each Annual Marketing Plan developed by Reseller
           during the term of this Agreement and any extension thereof may contain quotas agreed to by either TouchStar or Reseller for the
           sale by Reseller of TouchStar Software and Support Services without defined territory for the year to which such Annual Marketing Plan relates
           (the "Quotas"). Reseller acknowledges that meeting the Quotas is not an
           essential element of this Agreement and that this Agreement may not be
           terminated by TouchStar if, in TouchStar's reasonable opinion,
           Reseller will not meet the Quotas during the Term or any extension
           thereof.
perturbation.explanation: This modification introduces a contradiction by first removing the need for mutual agreement and specified territories (as the territory has been modified to encompass the entire world), and secondly by explicitly stating that meeting the Quotas is not essential and does not constitute grounds for termination, which directly contradicts the original text. This weakens TouchStar's ability to enforce performance standards and creates uncertainty about the reseller's obligations.

perturbation.original_text:
2.3  RESELLER'S OBLIGATION NOT TO COMPETE. Reseller shall not obtain the
           TouchStar Software or Support Services (or any software or services
           which compete with the TouchStar Software) for sale from any Entity
           other than TouchStar or its authorized agents. Nothing contained in
           this Agreement is intended to limit Reseller from responding to
           unsolicited requests from Customers from outside of the Territory;
           PROVIDED, HOWEVER, that Reseller shall (a) immediately notify
           TouchStar upon receipt of any such request and (b) not seek customers
           of TouchStar Software or Support Services in any other location other
           than in the Territory. Reseller shall not sell TouchStar Software or
           Support Services to any person or Entity outside the Territory or
           within the Territory if, to Reseller's knowledge, any such person or
           Entity intends to resell the TouchStar Software or Support Services
           outside of the Territory. Reseller shall not import, promote,
          distribute, license, market or sell any products in
          the Territory which directly compete with the TouchStar Software or
           Support Services.
perturbation.changed_text:
2.3  RESELLER'S OBLIGATION NOT TO COMPETE. Reseller may obtain the
           TouchStar Software or Support Services (or any software or services
           which compete with the TouchStar Software) for sale from any Entity
           other than TouchStar or its authorized agents. Nothing contained in
           this Agreement is intended to limit Reseller from responding to
           unsolicited requests from Customers from outside of the Territory;
           PROVIDED, HOWEVER, that Reseller shall (a) immediately notify
           TouchStar upon receipt of any such request and (b) seek customers
           of TouchStar Software or Support Services in any other location even if within the Territory. Reseller may sell TouchStar Software or
           Support Services to any person or Entity outside the Territory or
           within the Territory if, to Reseller's knowledge, any such person or
           Entity intends to resell the TouchStar Software or Support Services
           outside of the Territory. Reseller may import, promote,
          distribute, license, market or sell any products within the Territory which directly compete with the TouchStar Software or
           Support Services.
perturbation.explanation: This change directly contradicts the original non-compete clause, and references Section 1, which redefined the territory. Initially, the Reseller was prohibited from selling competing software or obtaining it from entities other than TouchStar. The modified version now allows the Reseller to sell competing products, obtain software from other entities, and actively solicit customers, even within TouchStar's original, albeit overwritten, territory. This creates a direct conflict with the intended exclusivity and introduces significant uncertainty about the Reseller's obligations and TouchStar's protections.
